name: slide_snake

detailed_description: A Snakemake workflow for the preprocessing, alignment, quality control, and quantification of spatial transcriptomics data (short and long read).

name: WES Pipeline

detailed_description: A comprehensive pipeline for Whole Exome Sequencing (WES) analysis, covering QC, trimming, alignment, and variant calling.

name: ArtificialFastqGenerator

name: MiTools

detailed_description: A shell script pipeline for RNA-seq analysis starting from FASTQ files. It performs QC with FastQC, alignment with STAR, quantification with featureCounts, and differential expression analysis using DESeq2.

name: NGS QC Toolkit

detailed_description: An analysis pipeline specifically designed for processing paired-end Illumina reads obtained from ancient mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) target enrichment capture experiments.

name: kseq-rs

name: nf-skyline-dia-ms

detailed_description: A Nextflow workflow designed for performing Data-Independent Acquisition (DIA) proteomics analysis, likely integrating with Skyline software.

name: NanoCount
one_line_profile: Transcript abundance estimation from nanopore reads
detailed_description: A tool for estimating transcript abundance from nanopore long reads that have been mapped to a transcriptome using minimap2, employing an Expectation-Maximization (EM) algorithm.

name: variant-calling-at-scale
one_line_profile: Scalable variant calling on cluster environments
detailed_description: A framework or set of tools designed to perform high-performance, scalable variant calling on cluster computing environments.

name: CNVnator
one_line_profile: CNV discovery and genotyping from depth-of-coverage
detailed_description: A widely used tool for Copy Number Variation (CNV) discovery and genotyping using read depth (RD) analysis of mapped reads.

name: CNVpytor
one_line_profile: Python extension of CNVnator for CNV analysis
detailed_description: A Python-based extension and improvement of CNVnator, offering functionality for CNV analysis and visualization from depth-of-coverage data.

name: GRIPper
one_line_profile: Detection of non-reference processed pseudogene insertions
detailed_description: A tool to identify non-reference processed pseudogene insertions by analyzing discordant read pair mappings in sequencing data.

name: fast-sg
one_line_profile: Ultrafast scaffolding graph construction from reads
detailed_description: An alignment-free algorithm designed for the rapid construction of scaffolding graphs from short or long sequencing reads, aiding in genome assembly.

name: paired
one_line_profile: Python package for pairwise sequence alignment
detailed_description: A Python package providing functionality for the pairwise alignment of arbitrary sequences, suitable for basic sequence comparison tasks.

name: cstag
one_line_profile: Python module to manipulate and visualize minimap2's cs tag
detailed_description: A Python module designed to parse, manipulate, and visualize the 'cs' (compact cigar) tag generated by minimap2, facilitating detailed alignment analysis.

name: LOGAN
one_line_profile: High-Performance Multi-GPU X-Drop Long-Read Alignment
detailed_description: A high-performance alignment tool that leverages multiple GPUs to accelerate X-Drop long-read alignment, optimizing processing speed for large datasets.

name: pairwise-alignment-in-python
one_line_profile: Implementation of Needleman-Wunsch and Smith-Waterman algorithms
detailed_description: A Python implementation of standard pairwise string alignment algorithms (Needleman-Wunsch for global and Smith-Waterman for local alignment), useful for educational purposes or lightweight alignment tasks.

name: SpliceWiz
one_line_profile: R package for differential alternative splicing analysis
detailed_description: An R package for analyzing differential alternative splicing events using splice-aware alignment BAM files, providing tools for quantification and visualization.

name: STAR
one_line_profile: Ultrafast universal RNA-seq aligner
detailed_description: Spliced Transcripts Alignment to a Reference (STAR) is a widely used, high-performance RNA-seq aligner known for its speed and accuracy in mapping reads to a reference genome.

name: SBWT
one_line_profile: Succinct k-mer set representation using Spectral Burrows-Wheeler Transform
detailed_description: A C++ implementation of the Spectral Burrows-Wheeler Transform (SBWT) for creating succinct representations of k-mer sets. It supports subset rank queries and is designed for efficient storage and querying of high-throughput sequencing data.

name: pseqsid
one_line_profile: Pairwise sequence identity and similarity calculator for proteins
detailed_description: A tool written in Rust to calculate pairwise sequence identity, similarity, and normalized similarity scores for proteins within a multiple sequence alignment (MSA).

name: SNAP
one_line_profile: Scalable Nucleotide Alignment Program for high-throughput sequencing
detailed_description: A fast and accurate read aligner designed for high-throughput sequencing data. It is optimized for speed and scalability, handling large datasets of nucleotide reads.

name: biostructmap
one_line_profile: Maps sequence-aligned data onto protein structures
detailed_description: A Python package that facilitates the mapping of data derived from sequence alignments (such as evolutionary rates or population genetics metrics) onto 3D protein structures for structural analysis.

name: parasailors
one_line_profile: Rust bindings for the Parasail SIMD alignment library
detailed_description: Provides Rust bindings to the Parasail library, enabling high-performance, SIMD-accelerated pairwise sequence alignment (Smith-Waterman, Needleman-Wunsch, etc.) within Rust applications.

name: genomics-data-index
one_line_profile: Genome indexing system using SNVs and kmers
detailed_description: A tool for indexing genomes based on SNVs, MLST profiles, or kmers to enable rapid querying, clustering, and visualization of large genomic datasets.

name: SOAP3-dp
one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated short-read aligner
detailed_description: A short-read aligner that leverages both CPU and GPU computational power to deliver high speed and sensitivity. It is part of the SOAP (Short Oligonucleotide Analysis Package) suite.

name: aligner-pytorch
one_line_profile: Differentiable sequence alignment for PyTorch
detailed_description: Implements sequence alignment algorithms (like soft-DTW or differentiable Needleman-Wunsch) as PyTorch modules, enabling their use in deep learning models for sequence analysis.

name: PAGAN2
one_line_profile: Phylogeny-aware multiple sequence aligner
detailed_description: An extension of the PAGAN multiple sequence alignment tool, designed to place sequences into an existing alignment and phylogenetic tree, or to construct new alignments using phylogenetic information.

name: EMA
one_line_profile: Aligner for barcoded short-reads (Linked-Reads)
detailed_description: A fast and accurate alignment tool specifically designed for barcoded short-reads (such as 10x Genomics Linked-Reads), utilizing barcode information to resolve mapping ambiguities.

name: minichain
one_line_profile: Long-read aligner to pangenome graphs
detailed_description: A tool for aligning long reads to pangenome graphs. It chains seeds on a graph to perform accurate mapping in the presence of structural variations.

name: mm2-plus
one_line_profile: Accelerated version of minimap2 for long-read mapping
detailed_description: A performance-optimized fork or variant of the minimap2 aligner, designed for fast long-read mapping and whole-genome alignment.

name: superSTR
one_line_profile: Alignment-free detector for repeat-containing reads
detailed_description: A lightweight, alignment-free utility designed to detect reads containing short tandem repeats (STRs) in short-read WGS, WES, and RNA-seq data.

name: 2passtools
one_line_profile: Two-pass alignment utility for long reads
detailed_description: A toolset to perform two-pass alignment for long reads, likely to improve alignment accuracy around difficult regions or splice sites.

name: DIAMOND
one_line_profile: High-performance protein sequence aligner
detailed_description: A sequence aligner for protein and translated DNA searches, designed to be a drop-in replacement for BLASTX and BLASTP but significantly faster, suitable for large-scale metagenomics analysis.

name: TMBur
one_line_profile: Tumor Mutational Burden estimation pipeline
detailed_description: A Nextflow pipeline that runs alignment and variant calling on whole genome FASTQ files to report Tumor Mutational Burden (TMB) estimates.

name: straglr
one_line_profile: Tandem repeat expansion detection from long-read alignments
detailed_description: A tool for detecting and genotyping tandem repeat expansions using long-read sequencing alignments (PacBio/Nanopore).

name: cPecan
one_line_profile: Pairwise multiple sequence alignment library
detailed_description: A standalone C and Python implementation of the pairwise multiple sequence alignment functionality originally developed for the Cactus alignment program.

name: KneadData
one_line_profile: Quality control for metagenomic sequencing data
detailed_description: A tool designed to perform quality control on metagenomic and metatranscriptomic sequencing data, specifically separating host reads from microbiome reads.

name: IDP
one_line_profile: Isoform Detection and Prediction using hybrid sequencing
detailed_description: A statistical method for isoform prediction that constructs candidate isoforms by combining long reads and short reads with spliced alignment.

name: browniealigner
one_line_profile: Short read aligner to de Bruijn graphs
detailed_description: An alignment algorithm specifically designed for mapping short Illumina reads to a de Bruijn graph structure.

name: biowasm
one_line_profile: WebAssembly modules for genomics tools
detailed_description: A project that compiles popular C/C++ genomics tools (like seqtk, samtools) into WebAssembly, enabling them to run directly in web browsers for client-side analysis.

name: epitopefindr
one_line_profile: Peptide sequence alignment and epitope identification
detailed_description: An R package that uses BLAST to align peptide sequences against each other to identify minimal overlapping regions, useful for epitope mapping.

name: bwa-meth
one_line_profile: Fast BS-Seq aligner using bwa-mem
detailed_description: A fast and accurate aligner for Bisulfite-Sequencing (BS-Seq) reads. It wraps bwa-mem and handles the 3-letter genome conversion required for methylation analysis.

name: fastq-join
one_line_profile: Tool for joining paired-end reads
detailed_description: A utility (part of ea-utils) that joins paired-end FASTQ reads based on squared distance anchored alignment, often used in preprocessing for amplicon sequencing.

name: bwa-mem2
one_line_profile: Optimized version of the BWA-MEM aligner
detailed_description: The next iteration of the popular bwa-mem aligner, optimized for performance using SIMD instructions to speed up alignment of DNA sequences.

name: WITCH
one_line_profile: Multiple sequence alignment method using weighted HMMs
detailed_description: WITCH is a multiple sequence alignment method that uses multiple weighted Hidden Markov Models (HMMs) to align unaligned sequences and find consensuses.

name: PCAP-core
one_line_profile: NGS mapping reference implementations for PanCancer
detailed_description: NGS reference implementations and helper code for mapping, originally developed as part of the ICGC-TCGA-PanCancer project.

name: psi
one_line_profile: Pan-genome Seed Index for sequence alignment
detailed_description: A Pan-genome Seed Index implementation designed to support efficient indexing and querying in pan-genomic analysis.

name: kallisto-nf
one_line_profile: Nextflow pipeline for Kallisto & Sleuth RNA-Seq analysis
detailed_description: A Nextflow implementation of the Kallisto and Sleuth tools for RNA-Seq quantification and differential expression analysis.

name: annotate_my_genomes
one_line_profile: Genome annotation pipeline using sequencing alignments
detailed_description: A genome annotation pipeline that utilizes short and long sequencing read alignments to annotate animal genomes.

name: hs-blastn
one_line_profile: Fast nucleotide-nucleotide sequence aligner
detailed_description: hs-blastn is a fast and accurate nucleotide-nucleotide sequence aligner designed for high-throughput sequence analysis.

name: BitMapperBS
one_line_profile: Fast aligner for whole-genome bisulfite sequencing
detailed_description: BitMapperBS is a fast and accurate read aligner specifically designed for whole-genome bisulfite sequencing (WGBS) data.

name: cljam
one_line_profile: SAM/BAM library for Clojure
detailed_description: A DNA Sequence Alignment/Map (SAM) and Binary Alignment/Map (BAM) library for the Clojure programming language, enabling manipulation of alignment data.

name: kallisto-align
one_line_profile: Export kallisto pseudo-alignments to sparse matrix
detailed_description: A utility to export kallisto pseudo-alignments into a sparse binary matrix format for downstream analysis.

name: BigBWA
one_line_profile: Hadoop-based BWA accelerator
detailed_description: BigBWA uses the Big Data technology Hadoop to boost the performance of the BurrowsWheeler aligner (BWA) for large-scale sequence alignment.

name: SparkBWA
one_line_profile: Spark-based BWA accelerator
detailed_description: SparkBWA exploits Apache Spark to boost the performance of the Burrows-Wheeler Aligner (BWA) for distributed sequence alignment.

name: Peregrine
one_line_profile: Fast Genome Assembler Using SHIMMER Index
detailed_description: Peregrine is a fast genome assembler that utilizes the SHIMMER index structure for efficient assembly of sequencing data.

name: PoGo
one_line_profile: Proteogenomic mapping tool for peptides
detailed_description: PoGo is a proteogenomic tool that allows mapping of peptides identified through mass spectrometry to a reference genome using gene annotations.

name: MetaSBT
one_line_profile: Scalable framework for indexing microbial genomes
detailed_description: MetaSBT is a scalable framework for automatically indexing microbial genomes and accurately characterizing metagenome-assembled genomes using Sequence Bloom Trees.

name: genomics-pipelines
one_line_profile: Spark-parallelized genomics secondary analysis pipelines
detailed_description: A set of secondary analysis pipelines for genomics data, parallelized using Apache Spark to improve performance and scalability.

name: rHAT
one_line_profile: PacBio sequence alignment tool
detailed_description: rHAT is a fast and accurate sequence alignment tool designed specifically for PacBio long reads.

name: DCC
one_line_profile: CircRNA detection from STAR chimeric reads
detailed_description: DCC detects back-splice junctions in next-generation sequencing data using output from the STAR read mapper to identify circular RNAs.

name: genozip
one_line_profile: High-performance genomic file compressor
detailed_description: Genozip is a modern compressor for genomic files (FASTQ, SAM/BAM/CRAM, VCF, etc.) offering high compression ratios and speed.

name: PacRAT
one_line_profile: Long-read barcode-variant mapping tool
detailed_description: PacRAT improves long-read barcode-variant mapping using multiple sequence alignment techniques.

name: MASA-CUDAlign
one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated DNA sequence aligner using Smith-Waterman/Needleman-Wunsch algorithms
detailed_description: An extension of the MASA architecture that utilizes NVIDIA CUDA GPUs to accelerate pairwise alignment of unrestricted size DNA sequences using Smith-Waterman and Needleman-Wunsch algorithms combined with Myers-Miller.

name: MASA-Core
one_line_profile: Multi-Platform Architecture framework for developing sequence alignment applications
detailed_description: A flexible software framework (Multi-Platform Architecture for Sequence Aligner) designed to simplify the creation of DNA sequence alignment applications across multiple hardware/software platforms, supporting huge DNA sequences.

name: pafcheck
one_line_profile: Validator for Pairwise Alignment Format (PAF) files
detailed_description: A command-line tool to validate PAF (Pairwise Alignment Format) files, specifically checking extended CIGAR strings and format consistency.

name: wflign
one_line_profile: WFA-guided ultralong tiling sequence aligner
detailed_description: A sequence aligner designed for ultralong sequences, using the Wavefront Alignment (WFA) algorithm to guide tiling alignment.

name: mapquik
one_line_profile: Efficient minimizer-space mapper for low-divergence long reads
detailed_description: A tool for mapping long reads with low divergence efficiently by operating in minimizer space, suitable for rapid mapping tasks.

name: genome_tracks
one_line_profile: Workflow for visualizing genome browser tracks from aligned BAM files
detailed_description: A Snakemake workflow and MrBiomics module that facilitates the creation and visualization of genome browser tracks (e.g., for RNA-seq, ATAC-seq) from aligned BAM files, leveraging pyGenomeTracks and IGV-reports.

name: vircov
one_line_profile: Viral genome coverage evaluation tool for metagenomics
detailed_description: A tool designed to evaluate viral genome coverage in metagenomic diagnostic contexts, aiding in the identification and analysis of viral pathogens.

name: AStarix
one_line_profile: Fast and optimal sequence-to-graph aligner
detailed_description: A sequence-to-graph aligner that uses the A* algorithm to find optimal alignments of sequences to reference graphs.

name: edlibR
one_line_profile: R interface for the edlib sequence alignment library
detailed_description: An R package providing bindings to edlib, a fast C/C++ library for pairwise sequence alignment using edit distance (Levenshtein distance).

name: PanPA
one_line_profile: Panproteome graph construction and sequence alignment tool
detailed_description: A tool for constructing panproteome graphs and aligning sequences back to these graphs, facilitating pangenomic analysis at the protein level.

name: bwt-lcp-in-place
one_line_profile: Constant space construction of BWT and LCP arrays
detailed_description: An implementation of algorithms for constructing Burrows-Wheeler Transform (BWT) and Longest Common Prefix (LCP) arrays in constant space, useful for indexing in bioinformatics.

name: CSA
one_line_profile: Cyclic DNA Sequence Aligner
detailed_description: A tool for aligning cyclic DNA sequences, addressing the specific challenge of circular genomes or plasmids.

name: slaMEM
one_line_profile: Maximal Exact Matches (MEMs) finder using Sampled LCP Array
detailed_description: A tool/library for finding Maximal Exact Matches (MEMs) in sequences using a Sampled LCP Array, a core operation in many sequence alignment algorithms.

name: QuasR
one_line_profile: R framework for quantification and analysis of short reads
detailed_description: An R/Bioconductor package providing a comprehensive workflow for analyzing short reads, including alignment (wrapping tools like Bowtie/SpliceMap), quality control, and quantification.

name: pairdist
one_line_profile: Neighbor-joining tree construction from pairwise alignments
detailed_description: A tool that creates neighbor-joining trees from a set of sequences by calculating maximum likelihood distances based on pairwise sequence alignments.

name: stampa
one_line_profile: Sequence Taxonomic Assignment by Massive Pairwise Alignments
detailed_description: A pipeline for taxonomic assignment of sequences using massive pairwise alignments, suitable for metabarcoding or metagenomic studies.

name: sge_mummer
one_line_profile: Parallel execution wrapper for MUMmer on SGE clusters
detailed_description: A set of scripts to parallelize MUMmer alignment jobs by splitting the reference sequence and distributing tasks on a Sun Grid Engine (SGE) cluster.

name: cblaster
one_line_profile: Tool for finding clustered hits from BLAST searches
detailed_description: A tool to identify and visualize clusters of co-located genomic hits from BLAST search results, useful for finding biosynthetic gene clusters.

name: Cell_BLAST
one_line_profile: BLAST-like toolkit for scRNA-seq data querying
detailed_description: A toolkit designed for large-scale single-cell RNA-seq data querying and annotation, using a BLAST-like search strategy to identify similar cells.

name: chrom_mini_graph
one_line_profile: Minimizer-based pangenome reference graph tool
detailed_description: A space-efficient tool for constructing pangenome reference graphs and performing haplotype mapping using minimizers.

name: MUMmer (HPC)
one_line_profile: HPC-optimized version of MUMmer aligner
detailed_description: A version of the MUMmer alignment system optimized for High Performance Computing (HPC) environments.

name: GenomeTools
one_line_profile: Comprehensive genome analysis system
detailed_description: A versatile open-source collection of tools for genome analysis, including sequence processing, annotation handling, and visualization.

name: XAVIER
one_line_profile: High-performance X-Drop adaptive banded pairwise alignment
detailed_description: A high-performance library/tool for pairwise sequence alignment using an X-Drop adaptive banded strategy, optimized for speed.

name: mummer-ggplot
one_line_profile: Visualization of MUMmer alignments using ggplot
detailed_description: An R-based tool to generate customizable and high-quality plots of genome alignments produced by MUMmer (Nucmer), leveraging ggplot2.

name: npInv
one_line_profile: Inversion detection and genotyping using long reads
detailed_description: A tool for accurately detecting and genotyping genomic inversions using multiple alignment of long reads (e.g., Nanopore).

name: RawMap
one_line_profile: Efficient mapping for Read-Until pipelines
detailed_description: A tool designed to complement Minimap2 for fast and efficient mapping in Nanopore Read-Until (adaptive sampling) pipelines.

name: fmlrc
one_line_profile: Long-read error correction tool using the multi-string Burrows Wheeler Transform
detailed_description: FMLRC is a tool for correcting long reads (e.g. Oxford Nanopore, PacBio) using high-accuracy short reads (e.g. Illumina). It utilizes an FM-index derived from the short reads to perform error correction.

name: MapCaller
one_line_profile: Efficient approach for short-read alignment and variant detection
detailed_description: MapCaller is an integrated system for short-read alignment and variant calling. It combines read mapping and variant detection into a single efficient process, optimizing for high-throughput genomic data.

name: SALMON (Survival Analysis)
one_line_profile: Survival Analysis Learning with Multi-Omics Neural Networks
detailed_description: SALMON is a deep learning framework for survival analysis that integrates multi-omics data. It is designed to handle high-dimensional biological data for clinical outcome prediction.

name: SalmonTE
one_line_profile: Ultra-Fast and Scalable Quantification Pipeline of Transpose Element Abundances
detailed_description: SalmonTE is a pipeline for quantifying Transposable Elements (TEs) from RNA-seq data. It leverages the Salmon tool for fast quantification without requiring full genome alignment.

name: Symphony
one_line_profile: Efficient and precise single-cell reference atlas mapping
detailed_description: Symphony is a tool for mapping single-cell query data onto reference atlases. It enables efficient transfer of annotations and embeddings from large-scale reference datasets to new query datasets.

name: bwa-aln-xeon-phi
one_line_profile: BWA alignment optimized for Intel Xeon Phi architecture
detailed_description: An optimized version of the BWA aligner specifically designed for Intel Xeon Phi platforms, supporting symmetric running models on hybrid nodes.

name: GraphMap
one_line_profile: Highly sensitive and accurate mapper for long, error-prone reads
detailed_description: GraphMap is a mapping algorithm designed for long-read sequencing data (e.g., Oxford Nanopore, PacBio). It is optimized for high error rates and provides sensitive alignment.

name: AlignQC
one_line_profile: Long read alignment analysis and quality control
detailed_description: AlignQC generates reports on sequence alignments, analyzing mappability, error patterns, and annotations. It is specifically designed for long-read sequencing data.

name: alignparse
one_line_profile: Align sequences and parse features for deep mutational scanning
detailed_description: Alignparse is a Python utility to align sequencing reads to a target sequence and parse specific features, commonly used in deep mutational scanning experiments.

name: parasail
one_line_profile: SIMD C library for global, semi-global, and local pairwise sequence alignments
detailed_description: Parasail is a high-performance C library for pairwise sequence alignment. It implements various alignment algorithms (Smith-Waterman, Needleman-Wunsch, etc.) using SIMD instructions for speed.

name: minimap2-rs
one_line_profile: Rust bindings to the minimap2 aligner library
detailed_description: Provides Rust bindings for the minimap2 C library, enabling developers to use the minimap2 alignment and mapping algorithms within Rust applications.

name: Kablammo
one_line_profile: Interactive web-based visualization tool for BLAST alignment results
detailed_description: Kablammo is a web-based tool designed to help researchers visualize BLAST results. It allows users to upload XML results from BLAST runs and provides an interactive graphical representation of the alignments, facilitating the interpretation of sequence similarities.

name: BWA-MEME
one_line_profile: Accelerated BWA-MEM2 aligner using learned-index structures
detailed_description: BWA-MEME is a sequence alignment tool that improves upon the performance of BWA-MEM2 by incorporating learned-index data structures. It is designed to speed up the alignment of short reads to reference genomes while maintaining accuracy.

name: MiniPhy
one_line_profile: Phylogenetic compression tool for large genome collections
detailed_description: MiniPhy is a tool for the phylogenetic compression of extremely large genome collections. It enables efficient storage and analysis of massive genomic datasets by leveraging phylogenetic relationships to compress data.

name: SVsearcher
one_line_profile: Structural variant detection from long read alignments
detailed_description: SVsearcher is a computational method for detecting structural variants (SVs) from long read alignment data. It is developed by the Ken Sung lab and focuses on identifying genomic variations using long-read sequencing technologies.

name: CryoREAD
one_line_profile: Deep learning tool for DNA/RNA structure modeling from cryo-EM maps
detailed_description: CryoREAD is a computational tool that utilizes deep learning to automatically build full atomic structures of DNA and RNA from cryo-EM maps. It aids structural biologists in interpreting density maps and modeling nucleic acid structures.

name: strobealign
one_line_profile: Fast short-read aligner using strobemers
detailed_description: strobealign is a fast and accurate aligner for short reads that uses strobemers as seeds. It is designed to offer a favorable trade-off between speed and accuracy for mapping high-throughput sequencing data.

name: ultra
one_line_profile: Accurate long-read splice alignment tool
detailed_description: uLTRA is a tool for aligning long transcriptomic reads to a genome. It is designed to handle splice junctions with high accuracy, making it suitable for RNA-seq analysis using long-read technologies like PacBio and Nanopore.

name: MetaLogo
one_line_profile: Heterogeneity-aware sequence logo generator and aligner
detailed_description: MetaLogo is a tool for generating sequence logos that can handle heterogeneity in sequence data. It includes alignment capabilities and is designed to visualize and analyze complex sequence motifs, such as those found in B-cell receptors or other diverse biological sequences.

name: LASTZ
one_line_profile: Pairwise DNA sequence aligner
detailed_description: LASTZ is a pairwise aligner for DNA sequences, designed as a drop-in replacement for BLASTZ. It is widely used for whole-genome alignment and comparative genomics to identify orthologous regions between species.

name: BWA
one_line_profile: Burrows-Wheeler Aligner for short-read alignment
detailed_description: BWA is a software package for mapping low-divergent sequences against a large reference genome, such as the human genome. It consists of three algorithms: BWA-backtrack, BWA-SW, and BWA-MEM, with BWA-MEM being the latest and generally recommended for high-quality queries.

name: fermi
one_line_profile: WGS de novo assembler based on FMD-index
detailed_description: Fermi is a de novo assembler for whole-genome sequencing (WGS) data. It utilizes the FMD-index for handling large genomes and includes modules for error correction and graph manipulation.

name: minimap
one_line_profile: Predecessor to minimap2 for mapping DNA sequences
detailed_description: Minimap is a tool for mapping DNA sequences, serving as the predecessor to minimap2. While deprecated in favor of minimap2, it remains a reference implementation for mapping algorithms.

name: minimap2
one_line_profile: Versatile pairwise aligner for genomic and spliced sequences
detailed_description: Minimap2 is a general-purpose alignment program for mapping DNA or long mRNA sequences against a large reference database. It is optimized for long reads (PacBio, Nanopore) and assembly-to-assembly alignment, but also supports short reads.

name: unimap
one_line_profile: Optimized aligner for assembly-to-reference alignment
detailed_description: Unimap is an experimental fork of minimap2, specifically optimized for aligning genome assemblies to a reference genome. It is designed to handle the specific challenges of assembly mapping.

name: jbwa
one_line_profile: Java Native Interface (JNI) bindings for BWA
detailed_description: jbwa provides Java bindings for the BWA aligner, allowing Java applications to directly utilize BWA's alignment algorithms via JNI. This enables the integration of BWA into Java-based bioinformatics pipelines.

name: MHAP
one_line_profile: MinHash Alignment Process for detecting long-read overlaps
detailed_description: MHAP (MinHash Alignment Process) uses locality-sensitive hashing to efficiently detect overlaps between noisy long reads. It is primarily used in the assembly of long-read sequencing data (e.g., PacBio).

name: MUMmer3
one_line_profile: System for rapidly aligning entire genomes
detailed_description: MUMmer3 is a versatile alignment package for comparing large scale DNA sequences. It can align whole genomes, incomplete genome assemblies, and other large sequence sets. It relies on suffix trees for efficient matching.

name: MashMap
one_line_profile: Fast approximate aligner for long DNA sequences
detailed_description: A fast approximate aligner for long DNA sequences that computes local alignment boundaries using MinHash sketching.

name: Winnowmap
one_line_profile: Long read and genome alignment software
detailed_description: A long-read aligner designed to handle repetitive reference sequences by using weighted minimizers.

name: KAST
one_line_profile: Alignment-free k-tuple frequency comparisons tool
detailed_description: Performs alignment-free k-tuple frequency comparisons from sequences, supporting pairwise comparisons for reference and query files.

name: Mapper
one_line_profile: Genomic sequence aligner implemented in Java
detailed_description: A genomic sequence aligner designed for mapping reads to reference genomes.

name: QuickEd
one_line_profile: High-performance exact sequence alignment tool
detailed_description: A high-performance exact sequence alignment tool based on the bound-and-align paradigm.

name: pafpy
one_line_profile: Library for working with PAF (Pairwise mApping Format) files
detailed_description: A lightweight Python library for parsing and working with PAF (Pairwise mApping Format) files commonly used in long-read alignment.

name: psdm
one_line_profile: Pairwise SNP distance matrix calculator
detailed_description: A tool to compute a pairwise SNP distance matrix from one or two alignments, useful for genomic epidemiology.

name: rasusa
one_line_profile: Randomly subsample sequencing reads or alignments
detailed_description: A tool to randomly subsample sequencing reads or alignments to a specified depth or coverage.

name: streamformatics
one_line_profile: Real-time species-typing visualisation for nanopore data
detailed_description: A tool for real-time visualisation of species typing results from nanopore sequencing data.

name: nanoranger
one_line_profile: Simplified cellranger for long-read data
detailed_description: A pipeline designed as a simplified version of Cell Ranger specifically for processing long-read single-cell sequencing data.

name: variant_calling_pipeline
one_line_profile: Variant calling and annotation pipeline
detailed_description: A pipeline for variant calling and annotation using BWA, GATK, and ENSEMBL, implemented with the Rubra/Ruffus framework.

name: mummer2circos
one_line_profile: Circular bacterial genome plots from alignments
detailed_description: A tool to generate circular bacterial genome plots (Circos) based on BLAST or NUCMER/PROMER alignments.

name: HAlign-4
one_line_profile: Rapid multiple sequence alignment tool
detailed_description: A strategy and tool for rapidly aligning millions of sequences (Multiple Sequence Alignment).

name: IMOS
one_line_profile: Distributed long read aligner on Spark
detailed_description: Improved Meta-aligner and Minimap2 On Spark, a distributed long read aligner designed for big data environments.

name: rBLAST
one_line_profile: R interface for BLAST
detailed_description: An R package providing an interface for the Basic Local Alignment Search Tool (BLAST).

name: SMART
one_line_profile: Semi-manual alignment to reference templates for whole brain mapping
detailed_description: An open source pipeline in R for whole brain mapping and semi-manual alignment to reference templates.

name: sam2pairwise
one_line_profile: Reconstruct pairwise alignment from SAM files
detailed_description: A tool that takes a SAM file and uses the CIGAR and MD tags to reconstruct and display the pairwise alignment of each read.

name: CONSENT
one_line_profile: Scalable long read self-correction and assembly polishing
detailed_description: A tool for scalable long read self-correction and assembly polishing using multiple sequence alignment.

name: HG-CoLoR
one_line_profile: Hybrid error correction for long reads
detailed_description: A hybrid method based on a variable-order de Bruijn Graph for the error correction of long reads.

name: TranscriptClean
one_line_profile: Correct errors in mapped long reads

name: MUMmer

detailed_description: A pipeline to identify ultra-conserved elements (UCEs) from pairwise genome alignments.

name: NGLess

name: r-index

name: mm2-ivh

detailed_description: A modification of the minimap2 aligner that incorporates interval hashing techniques for sequence mapping.
